metadata_new.m_contract_name: Liberia, The Liberia Company, Statement of Understanding, 17 December 1949
metadata_new.n_resources: Theobroma cacao (Cocoa plant), Coffee, Oil palm products

contract_name: Liberia, The Liberia Company, Statement of Understanding, 17 December 1949
file_name: Liberia, The Liberia Company, Statement of Understanding, 17 December 1949

annotations.category: Parent companies or affilates outside of the country, if different from the above mentioned; and their corporate headquarters
Type of document / right (Concession, Lease, Production Sharing Agreement, Service Agreement, etc.)
Name and/or number of field, block or deposit
Location, longitude and latitude /  Onshore vs Offshore (shallow vs. deep)
Name of company executing the document and composition of the shareholders
State agency, national company, ministry executing the document
Name and/or composition of the company created or anticipated
Name of third party to contract (where applicable)
Type of resources (mineral type, crude oil, gas, timber, etc.) OR specific crops planned (ex:  food crops, oil palm, etc.)

annotations.text: Up to 150,000 acres; subsequent acreage, if any, shall be determined by mutual agreement. In addition, The Liberia Company shall have the right to prospect in the public domain for 12 years following the contract's effective date.

annotations.category: Protection of sacred locations, resources and environment
Social, land or human rights impact assessments
Social/human rights management plans and monitoring requirements

annotations.text: If any acreage selected by The Liberia Company for its agricultural operations is not owned by the Government, the Government will assist the company to acquire leasehold rights to the land and agrees to use its good offices to see that compensation is just and reasonable. The Government will also help The Liberia Company in acquiring leasehold rights to land for mining purposes or related activities, at the expense of the company.

annotations.category: Outgrowers' Program (details, additional land provided, etc)
Rights of access/use to concession area for non-contracting parties (including permitted independent farming in concession area)

Requirements regarding workers or farm/concession dwellers within concession areas or in nearby communities in respect of occupational health and safety, access to clean water, housing, medical care, or education
Food security clause (ex: when food can be exported, what happens in times of food crises, etc)
Physical security, protection of property, and/or use of guards
Grievance mechanisms for non-contractual harms to non-contracting parties
Other income tax features (amortization, deductibility of expenses, loss carry forward, ring-fencing)
Production Share - "Cost Oil" features  (basis of calculation, limits on cost recovery - e.g. as % of revenue or production, capex uplift, etc.)
Production Share - "Profit Oil" features  (triggers for variations in split - IRR, "r" factor, production, etc.)
Service Agreement - Fee to developer / contractor (basis for calculation)
Witholding tax on services of non-resident companies
Fixed fee for grant and renewal of license

annotations.text: $ 0.06 (six cents) per acre per year, and $1 per acre per year for areas used for mining activities

annotations.category: Restrictions on transactions with affiliated parties
Protection of environment, harvesting practices (for forestry contracts), prevention of pollution, etc
Right to take and/or use water within/near contract concession area (including fees, licenses, and permits required)
Feasibility studies and requirement of business plan
Marketing of output and state access to output

annotations.text: The Liberia Company must exercise its rights under the contract within two years

annotations.category: Contracting party's permitted use of public or private land outside concession area
Governing law in case of dispute
Reporting Requirements and other methods of monitoring compliance
